autumn.util.ds

Interface Counter<T>

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    HashCounter

    public interface Counter<T>
    An instance of this interface is a data-structure that can be used for counting values.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void add(T value)
      This method adds the value to the total.
      int count(T value)
      This method counts the number of times that a particular value was encountered.
      void subtract(T value)
      This method subtracts the value from the total.
      java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer> toMap()
      This method creates map that maps a value to the number of times it was counted.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        void add(T value)
        This method adds the value to the total.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to count.

      • subtract

        void subtract(T value)
        This method subtracts the value from the total.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to subtract.

      • count

        int count(T value)
        This method counts the number of times that a particular value was encountered.
        Parameters:
        value - is the value to count.
        Returns:
        the number of times the value was added to this counter.

      • toMap

        java.util.Map<T,java.lang.Integer> toMap()
        This method creates map that maps a value to the number of times it was counted.

        A count may be negative, if more subtractions occurred than additions.

        Returns:
        the aforesaid map that is backed by this counter.
